# Product Hunt Launch Preparation

## Basic Info

**Name:** Domain Search MCP

**Tagline (60 chars max):**
```
Check domain availability directly from Claude AI
```

**Description:**
```
Domain Search MCP is an open-source tool that gives Claude AI the ability to check domain availability in real-time.

Stop context-switching between your AI assistant and domain registrars. Just ask Claude "Is mybrand.com available?" and get instant results with pricing from multiple sources.

üîç What it does:
‚Ä¢ Check domain availability across Porkbun, Namecheap, RDAP, WHOIS
‚Ä¢ Compare prices between registrars instantly
‚Ä¢ Check social handle availability (GitHub, Twitter, npm, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Understand why premium domains are expensive
‚Ä¢ Track when taken domains will expire

‚ö° Key features:
‚Ä¢ Works with zero configuration (uses public RDAP/WHOIS)
‚Ä¢ Add registrar API keys for real-time pricing
‚Ä¢ 50+ TLD support including .com, .io, .dev, .ai, and more
‚Ä¢ Sherlock-style social media username checking
‚Ä¢ Security audited, 98 tests passing

üõ† Built with:
‚Ä¢ TypeScript + Zod validation
‚Ä¢ Model Context Protocol (MCP) by Anthropic
‚Ä¢ MIT License, fully open source

Perfect for:
‚Ä¢ Developers brainstorming project names
‚Ä¢ Startup founders checking brand availability
‚Ä¢ Anyone who uses Claude for ideation
```

## First Comment (Maker's Comment):
```
Hey Product Hunt! üëã

I'm the maker of Domain Search MCP.

The problem: I use Claude constantly for brainstorming. Every time I come up with a project name, I have to leave Claude, open a domain registrar, check if it's available, and then go back to report the result. This breaks my flow.

The solution: An MCP server that lets Claude check domains directly. Now I just ask "Is coolname.com available?" and Claude tells me instantly ‚Äî with pricing from multiple registrars.

This is open source (MIT license) and works with Claude Desktop. Would love your feedback!

Try it: npx @anthropic/claude-code mcp add domain-search-mcp
```
